meanings.definition: A person or thing that feeds.
meanings.sent1: The kind grandmother was the main feeder of the family, always making sure everyone had enough to eat.
meanings.sent2: The bird feeder in the garden attracted many colorful birds.
meanings.sent3: The hungry puppy thought the shoe was a feeder and tried to nibble on it.
meanings.sent4: Her stories were the feeders of our imagination, sparking creativity in all of us.
meanings.sent5: The feeder at the zoo made sure all the animals were well-fed and happy.

meanings.definition: A device or container for supplying food to animals or birds.
meanings.sent1: The automatic fish feeder dispensed food for the fish at regular intervals.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel feeder in the backyard was always full of nuts.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon figured out how to open the feeder and help itself to the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: The feeder in the park was a hub of activity, with birds and squirrels gathering around.
meanings.sent5: The feeder was designed to release just the right amount of food for the hungry animals.

meanings.definition: A stream that flows into a larger body of water.
meanings.sent1: The small feeder joined the main river downstream, adding to its volume.
meanings.sent2: The feeder brought fresh water from the mountains into the lake.
meanings.sent3: The feeder meandered through the meadow, creating a peaceful babbling sound.
meanings.sent4: The feeder was a lifeline for the parched land, providing much-needed water.
meanings.sent5: The feeder was teeming with fish, attracting anglers looking for a catch.
